thread.title: Brignone leads Shiffrin by 0.95 in 1st run of World Cup GS
thread.title_full: Brignone leads Shiffrin by 0.95 in 1st run of World Cup GS

title: Brignone leads Shiffrin by 0.95 in 1st run of World Cup GS
text:
Italy's Brignone holds big 0.95 lead over US skier Shiffrin after 1st run of World Cup GS 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS October 24, 2015 - 4:58 am EDT 
SOELDEN, Austria — Federica Brignone of Italy built a commanding lead in the first run of the season-opening women's World Cup giant slalom on Saturday. 
Brignone led Mikaela Shiffrin of the United States by 0.95, while Tina Weirather of Liechtenstein was already 1.42 behind in third. The rest of the field had at least 1 ½ seconds to make up in the second run. Liechtenstein's Tina Weirather skies past a gate during the first run of a Ski World Cup women's Giant Slalom in Soelden, Austria, Saturday, Oct. 24, 2015. (AP Photo/Alessandro Trovati) 
Brignone, who finished her run in sunny conditions on the Rettenbach glacier in 1 minute, 10.11 seconds, has finished seven times on a podium but is yet to win a GS. 
Shiffrin won the race here last season, sharing victory with overall champion Anna Fenninger. The Austrian has been ruled out for the season after knee surgery. 
Lindsey Vonn was skipping the race having recovered from an ankle injury.
